psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Am 3,1]]Hear this word, O children of Israel, that the LORD pronounces over you, over the whole family that I brought up from the land of Egypt:
[[Am 3,2]]You alone have I favored, more than all the families of the earth; Therefore I will punish you for all your crimes.
[[Am 3,3]]Do two walk together unless they have agreed?
[[Am 3,4]]Does a lion roar in the forest when it has no prey? Does a young lion cry out from its den unless it has seized something?
[[Am 3,5]]Is a bird brought to earth by a snare when there is no lure for it? Does a snare spring up from the ground without catching anything?
[[Am 3,6]]If the trumpet sounds in a city, will the people not be frightened? If evil befalls a city, has not the LORD caused it?
[[Am 3,7]]Indeed, the Lord GOD does nothing without revealing his plan to his servants, the prophets.
[[Am 3,8]]The lion roars-- who will not be afraid! The Lord GOD speaks-- who will not prophesy!
[[Am 4,11]]I brought upon you such upheaval as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah: you were like a brand plucked from the fire; Yet you returned not to me, says the LORD.
[[Am 4,12]]So now I will deal with you in my own way, O Israel! and since I will deal thus with you, prepare to meet your God, O Israel:
first_reading.title: Book of Amos

gospel.text:
[[Mt 8,23]]As Jesus got into a boat, his disciples followed him.
[[Mt 8,24]]Suddenly a violent storm came up on the sea, so that the boat was being swamped by waves; but he was asleep.
[[Mt 8,25]]They came and woke him, saying, "Lord, save us! We are perishing!"
[[Mt 8,26]]He said to them, "Why are you terrified, O you of little faith?" Then he got up, rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was great calm.
[[Mt 8,27]]The men were amazed and said, "What sort of man is this, whom even the winds and the sea obey?"
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
